member.name: IAMDroppedFrames.GetAverageFrameSize

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAverageFrameSize method retrieves the average size of the frames that the filter has captured.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the average frame size, in bytes, since the filter began streaming.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMDroppedFrames.GetDroppedInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDroppedInfo method retrieves an array of frame numbers that were dropped.

member.param: Specifies the size of the array.

Pointer to an array of size lSize, allocated by the caller. The method fills the array with the frame numbers of the first lSize frames that were dropped, up to a maximum number that is device-dependent.
Pointer to a variable that receives the number of items returned in plArray. This number might be less than the value of lSize.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Invalid argument; the lSize parameter must by greater than zero.

member.name: IAMDroppedFrames.GetNumDropped

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetNumDropped method retrieves the total number of frames that the filter has dropped since it started streaming.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of dropped frames.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMDroppedFrames.GetNumNotDropped

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetNumNotDropped method retrieves the total number of frames that the filter has delivered since it started streaming.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of delivered frames.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMDroppedFrames interface retrieves performance information from a video capture filter, including how many frames were dropped and how many were delivered. Applications can use this interface to determine capture performance at run-time.
